defaultRecipes.title: Chicken Katsu Curry
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper, dredge in flour, dip in beaten egg, then coat in panko.
Shallow-fry cutlets in 350°F/175°C oil until golden and cooked through; drain on a rack.
In a pot, sauté sliced onion until soft; add carrot and potato and cook 2-3 min.
Pour in water to cover, simmer until vegetables are tender.
Stir in curry roux blocks to thicken; simmer 2-3 min more.
Slice katsu and serve over steamed rice with hot curry sauce.

defaultRecipes.title: Garlic Shoyu Saimin
instructions: Bring chicken broth to a simmer; add soy sauce and 1-2 minced garlic cloves.
Cook saimin noodles per package; drain.
Slice kamaboko and char siu thinly.
Divide noodles into bowls; ladle hot broth over.
Top with char siu, kamaboko, chopped green onion, and nori strips.

defaultRecipes.title: Hawaiian Garlic Shrimp Plate
instructions: Pat shrimp dry; season with salt, pepper, and paprika; lightly dust with flour.
Melt butter in a skillet; add lots of minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Add shrimp; sauté until pink and just cooked through.
Squeeze lemon over shrimp; toss to coat.
Serve with white rice and a scoop of macaroni salad.

defaultRecipes.title: Spicy Tuna Poke Bowl
instructions: Cube sushi-grade tuna; chill.
Mix soy sauce, mayo, sriracha, and a few drops of sesame oil.
Toss tuna with sauce and sliced green onion.
Serve over warm rice with avocado.
Finish with sesame seeds (optional furikake).

defaultRecipes.title: Creamy Tomato Penne
instructions: Boil penne in salted water until al dente.
Sauté minced garlic in olive oil 30-60 sec; add crushed tomatoes and simmer 5 min.
Stir in cream; season with salt and pepper.
Toss in drained penne; add grated parmesan.
Top with torn basil to serve.

defaultRecipes.title: Mushroom Tofu Mapo
instructions: Dry-saute diced shiitake to concentrate flavor; add oil, minced garlic, and ginger.
Stir in doubanjiang; cook 30 sec to bloom.
Add vegetable broth and cubed soft tofu; simmer gently 3-4 min.
Season with soy sauce; add cornstarch slurry to thicken.
Finish with ground Sichuan peppercorns and green onion.

defaultRecipes.title: Shoyu Chicken
instructions: In a large pot, combine soy sauce, water, brown sugar, sliced ginger, and crushed garlic. Stir until the sugar dissolves.
Add chicken thighs, ensuring they are mostly covered by the sauce.
Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce to low heat and simmer for 25–30 minutes.
Flip the chicken halfway through so both sides absorb the flavor.
Remove the lid near the end to let the sauce reduce and thicken into a glaze.
Serve hot over steamed rice and garnish with chopped green onions.

defaultRecipes.title: Loco Moco
instructions: Shape the ground beef into patties and season both sides with salt and pepper.
Cook patties in a skillet over medium-high heat until browned and cooked through; remove and set aside.
In the same pan, melt butter and sauté sliced onions until soft and golden.
Add flour and stir for 1 minute to form a roux.
Gradually whisk in beef broth and soy sauce until smooth; simmer until thickened into gravy.
Fry eggs sunny-side up in a separate pan.
Assemble: scoop rice onto a plate, top with a beef patty, pour gravy generously, and finish with a fried egg on top.

defaultRecipes.title: Teriyaki Salmon
instructions: Whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sugar, grated ginger, and minced garlic to make the teriyaki sauce.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a skillet over medium heat and place salmon fillets skin-side down.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until the skin is crisp, then flip.
Pour the teriyaki sauce into the pan and simmer until the sauce thickens and coats the fish.
Spoon extra glaze over the top and sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

defaultRecipes.title: Spam Musubi
instructions: Cut spam into 6–8 slices and pan-fry in a nonstick pan until both sides are lightly browned.
Mix soy sauce and sugar in the pan and cook until the spam slices are evenly coated and caramelized.
Place a slice of glazed spam on top of a compact block of warm rice (use a musubi mold or shape by hand).
Wrap a strip of nori around the center to hold it together.
Let it cool slightly before serving or wrapping for later.

defaultRecipes.title: Kimchi Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat and add chopped kimchi; cook for 1–2 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in a spoonful of gochujang and mix well to coat the kimchi.
Add day-old rice, breaking up any clumps, and stir-fry until the rice is hot and evenly mixed.
Add a splash of soy sauce and drizzle a little sesame oil for flavor.
Top with a fried egg and sprinkle chopped green onions before serving.

defaultRecipes.title: Vegetable Yakisoba
instructions: In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, worcestershire sauce, and ketchup to make yakisoba sauce.
Heat oil in a pan and stir-fry sliced onion, cabbage, and carrot until slightly softened.
Add the noodles to the pan, pour in the sauce, and toss until everything is evenly coated and hot.
Cook for another 2–3 minutes until the noodles absorb the sauce.
Serve warm and top with green onions or pickled ginger if desired.

defaultRecipes.title: Huli Huli Chicken
instructions: In a bowl, combine pineapple juice, soy sauce, brown sugar, ketchup, grated ginger, and minced garlic.
Marinate chicken thighs in the mixture for at least 30 minutes (or overnight for more flavor).
Preheat the grill to medium heat and cook the chicken, turning and basting with leftover sauce every few minutes.
Continue grilling until the chicken is cooked through and slightly charred at the edges.
Let it rest for a few minutes, then slice and serve with rice.

defaultRecipes.title: Miso Soup with Tofu
instructions: Bring dashi broth to a gentle simmer in a small pot.
Place miso paste in a ladle, add a little hot broth, and stir until smooth before mixing it back into the pot.
Add cubed tofu and soaked wakame seaweed; warm gently without boiling.
Garnish with sliced green onions and serve hot.

defaultRecipes.title: Veggie Fried Rice
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet and sauté minced garlic for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add frozen peas, carrots, and corn; stir-fry for 2–3 minutes.
Add day-old rice and stir until hot and well mixed.
Pour in soy sauce and toss to coat evenly.
Finish with a drizzle of sesame oil and chopped green onions before serving.

defaultRecipes.title: Tofu Katsu Curry
instructions: Press tofu for 10 minutes to remove excess water, then slice into thick pieces.
Season with salt and pepper, dredge in flour, dip in plant milk, then coat with panko.
Fry tofu slices in hot oil until golden brown and crisp; set aside on a paper towel.
In a saucepan, sauté onions, carrots, and potatoes until slightly softened, then add water and simmer until tender.
Stir in curry roux blocks to thicken the sauce.
Serve tofu katsu over rice topped with the warm curry sauce.

defaultRecipes.title: Garlic Butter Steak Bites
instructions: Cut steak into bite-sized cubes and pat dry with paper towels.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Heat a pan over high heat and sear the steak cubes for 1-2 minutes per side until browned.
Reduce heat to medium, add butter and minced garlic, and cook for 30 seconds.
Add a splash of soy sauce and toss the steak in the garlic butter.
Sprinkle with chopped green onions before serving.

defaultRecipes.title: Okinawan Sweet Potato Mash
instructions: Peel and cut Okinawan sweet potatoes into cubes.
Boil in salted water for 12–15 minutes until tender when pierced with a fork.
Drain and mash with butter until smooth.
Add warm milk or cream to reach the desired texture.
Season with salt and serve warm as a side dish.

defaultRecipes.title: Chicken Karaage Rice Bowl
instructions: Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces and marinate in soy sauce, sake, grated ginger, and minced garlic for 10–15 minutes.
Coat each piece with potato starch until evenly covered.
Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) and fry chicken in small batches until golden brown and crisp.
Drain on a rack or paper towels and squeeze a little lemon juice over the top.
Serve over a bowl of hot white rice.

defaultRecipes.title: Chicken Stir Fry
instructions: Slice chicken breasts into thin strips and season lightly with salt.
Heat oil in a large pan or wok and cook the chicken until no longer pink.
Add minced garlic and mixed vegetables (like broccoli, carrots, and bell peppers).
Stir-fry for 3–5 minutes until vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Pour in soy sauce and toss everything together for 1 more minute.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

defaultRecipes.title: Spaghetti Bolognese
instructions: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted water until al dente; drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a pan, then sauté minced onion and garlic until fragrant.
Add ground beef and cook until browned, breaking it apart with a spatula.
Stir in tomato sauce and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 10–15 minutes until thick and flavorful.
Serve sauce over spaghetti and sprinkle with parmesan if desired.

defaultRecipes.title: Omelette
instructions: Crack eggs into a bowl, add milk, salt, and pepper, and whisk until smooth and slightly frothy.
Heat butter in a nonstick pan over medium heat until melted.
Pour in the egg mixture and swirl to coat the pan evenly.
When the bottom is set but the top is still soft, fold the omelette in half.
Cook another 30 seconds, then slide onto a plate.

defaultRecipes.title: Pancakes
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, and baking powder.
Add milk and egg, and stir until you get a smooth batter.
Melt butter in a pan over medium heat and pour in about 1/4 cup of batter per pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, then flip and cook the other side until golden.
Serve with butter, syrup, or fruit.
